Task:
  The response arranges items into categories or an order using a specified or inferred scheme.
constraints: Completeness ("deep"): The response goes into substantial depth within the chosen scope, unpacking reasoning layers and fine details without necessarily enumerating every edge case.

Scope ("time"): The response focuses on when things occur and how they change over time—sequences, evolution, history, phases, or temporal dynamics—rather than static structure, evaluation, or immediate action.
Form ("faq"): The response organizes ideas as clearly separated question headings with concise answers beneath each one, keeping content easy to skim and free of long uninterrupted prose.
Directional ("fip rog"): The response modifies the task to move between abstract principles and concrete examples while examining structural patterns and reflecting on what they reveal.
